DataElement.preferredName: Head And Neck Soft Tissue Sarcoma AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Tumor T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary soft tissue sarcoma of the head and neck based on information obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Head And Neck Soft Tissue Sarcoma Clinical T Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The anterior and superior part of a human bearing the mouth, the brain and sensory organs._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The region that connects the head to the rest of the body._A malignant neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

A malignant neoplasm arising from muscle tissue, adipose tissue, blood vessels, fibrous tissue, or other supportive tissues excluding the bones.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System

ValueDomain.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma Head And Neck American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 T Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of soft tissue sarcoma of the head and neck, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This classification system applies to soft tissue sarcomas of the head and neck except angiosarcoma, rhabdomyosarcoma of the embryonal and alveolar subtype, Kaposi sarcoma, and dermatofibrosarcoma protuberans, which do not share the same behavior and natural history. This is a new classification system that needs data collection before defining a stage grouping for head and neck sarcomas. Sarcomas of the orbit are staged according to the orbital sarcoma classification system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT4b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT4b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the head and neck with tumor invading the brain parenchyma, prevertebral muscle, central nervous system via perineural spread, or carotid artery encasement. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT4b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the head and neck with tumor invading the brain parenchyma, prevertebral muscle, central nervous system via perineural spread, or carotid artery encasement. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT4a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT4a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the head and neck with tumor invading the orbit, skull base/dura, central compartment viscera, facial skeleton, or pterygoid muscles. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT4a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the head and neck with tumor invading the orbit, skull base/dura, central compartment viscera, facial skeleton, or pterygoid muscles. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT4 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT4 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the head and neck with tumor invading adjoining structures. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT4 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the head and neck with tumor invading adjoining structures. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the head and neck with tumor measuring more than 4 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the head and neck with tumor measuring more than 4 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the head and neck with tumor measuring more than 2 cm but 4 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the head and neck with tumor measuring more than 2 cm but 4 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the head and neck with tumor measuring 2 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pT1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the head and neck with tumor measuring 2 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pTX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pTX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the head and neck in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Soft Tissue Sarcoma of the Head and Neck pTX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Soft tissue sarcoma of the head and neck in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

This classification system applies to soft tissue sarcomas of the head and neck except angiosarcoma, rhabdomyosarcoma of the embryonal and alveolar subtype, Kaposi sarcoma, and dermatofibrosarcoma protuberans, which do not share the same behavior and natural history. This is a new classification system that needs data collection before defining a stage grouping for head and neck sarcomas. Sarcomas of the orbit are staged according to the orbital sarcoma classification system. This classification system applies to soft tissue sarcomas of the head and neck except angiosarcoma, rhabdomyosarcoma of the embryonal and alveolar subtype, Kaposi sarcoma, and dermatofibrosarcoma protuberans, which do not share the same behavior and natural history. This is a new classification system that needs data collection before defining a stage grouping for head and neck sarcomas. Sarcomas of the orbit are staged according to the orbital sarcoma classification system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
